meanings.definition: Abjurers: those who renounce or reject something, especially under oath.
meanings.sent1: The abjurers refused to testify in court, even when sworn in.
meanings.sent2: The group of abjurers publicly denounced their former beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The abjurers at the meeting comically pretended to forget their promises.
meanings.sent4: She saw the abjurers as brave warriors, fighting against their own past.
meanings.sent5: The image of the abjurers tearing up their old vows was unforgettable.
